list_definition.definition: to make able by giving means, power or authority (to do something)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The money I inherited enabled me to go on a world cruise.

list_ex_of_english: The scene also enables members across the world to interact on a fairly equal basis.
The evolution history explorer enables the designer to explore the evolution history of any item selected from the overview.
The proposed approach enables design decision rules, which are used in the mapping process, to be extracted from past design information.
If the task of architecture is to represent order, its means are enabled by eloquence.
The concept of shape grammar enables the establishment of an initial shape or subset of shapes, which are subsequently transformed through the application of rules.
A low dynamic requirement enables the users to control patient hematocrit and minimize possible blood transfusion requirements.
Mercantilist economic doctrines too enabled the condemnation of the 'indolent' including 'savages'.
Neither time nor the scaffolding condition enabled the late talkers to narrow the gap between their narrative skills and those of the comparison peers.
